O **c√°lculo de limites** √© uma ferramenta central no estudo do comportamento de fun√ß√µes.

## Exemplo

$$
\lim_{x \to 2} (x^2 + 3x - 4)
$$

```{python}
import sympy as sp

x = sp.symbols('x')
f = x**2 + 3*x - 4
limite = sp.limit(f, x, 2)
limite
```

Gr√°fico da fun√ß√£o:

```{python}
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

x_vals = np.linspace(0, 4, 100)
y_vals = x_vals**2 + 3*x_vals - 4

plt.plot(x_vals, y_vals, label="f(x)")
plt.axvline(2, color='r', linestyle='--', label="x = 2")
plt.axhline(limite.evalf(), color='g', linestyle=':', label="lim f(x) = " + str(limite))
plt.title("Fun√ß√£o f(x) = x¬≤ + 3x - 4")
plt.xlabel("x")
plt.ylabel("f(x)")
plt.grid(True)
plt.legend()
plt.show()
```
